title: Ticket #7832: condor_annex -check-setup ignoring -aws-region flag?
description:
The check-setup command of condor_annex was never updated to handle multiple regions. Additionally, the setup command was not setting the default region. I decided that setup command should set the default region if it weren't already set by the configuration, so that 

$ condor_annex -aws-region us-east-2 -setup
$ condor_annex -check-setup

would work properly, but not change the user's default region if they setup more than one.

original description

A user reports that condor_annex -check-setup was failing because it couldn't find the configuration bucket: 

$ condor_annex -aws-region us-west-2 -setup ~/.condor/publicKeyFile
$ condor_annex -check-setup

Adding '-aws-region us-west-2' to the second line didn't solve the problem.

The user was able to successfully check their set-up when not specifying the AWS region at all, so the problem is likely that -check-setup is ignoring ANNEX_DEFAULT_AWS_REGION and/or the -aws-region flag (since the user had ANNEX_DEFAULT_AWS_REGION set to 'us-west-2' in their user_config file) and the user implicitly confirmed that the CloudFormation stacks were created in us-west-2.
remarks:
2020-Sep-01 12:59:12 by tlmiller: 
$ condor_annex -aws-region us-west-2 -setup
Creating configuration bucket (this takes less than a minute).. complete.
Creating Lambda functions (this takes about a minute).. complete.
Creating instance profile (this takes about two minutes).. complete.
Creating security group (this takes less than a minute).. complete.
Setup successful.

$ condor_annex -check-setup
Your setup is incomplete:
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_ACCESS_KEY_FILE is unset.
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_SECRET_KEY_FILE is unset.
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_S3_BUCKET is unset.
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_ODI_SECURITY_GROUP_IDS is unset.
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_ODI_LEASE_FUNCTION_ARN is unset.
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_SFR_LEASE_FUNCTION_ARN is unset.
        ANNEX_DEFAULT_ODI_INSTANCE_PROFILE_ARN is unset.
Secret key file must be accessible only by owner.  Please verify that your user owns the file and that the file permissons are restricted to the owner.

Adding 

~/.condor/user_config 
ANNEX_DEFAULT_AWS_REGION = us-west-2

reproduced the user's problem.

2020-Sep-01 13:07:33 by tlmiller:
Should we set ANNEX_DEFAULT_AWS_REGION when -setup is executed with a -aws-region flag? Even if it's already set?

2020-Sep-03 17:14:15 by tlmiller:
Yes and no, respectively.
